content: SAN FRANCISCO Alphabet Inc's  Google reclaimed on Tuesday its spot as the default search engine on Mozilla Corp's Firefox Internet browser in the United States and other regions as the browser maker stunned Verizon Communication Inc's  Yahoo by canceling their deal.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Firefox opts for Google as default search in U.S.  surprising Yahoo

title: Former Yahoo CEO apologizes for data breaches  blames Russians

content: WASHINGTON  Nov 8 Former Yahoo Chief Executive Marissa Mayer apologized on Wednesday for a pair of massive data breaches at the internet company and blamed Russian agents at a hearing on the growing number of incidents involving major U.S. companies.

title: Former Yahoo CEO apologizes for data breach  blames Russians

content: WASHINGTON Former Yahoo Chief Executive Marissa Mayer and the current and former CEOs of Equifax Inc  will testify before a U.S. Senate panel on Nov. 8 on two massive data breaches  the committee said Wednesday.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Former Yahoo CEO  Equifax CEO to testify at Senate hearing

content: WASHINGTON Verizon Communication Inc  media chief Marni Walden confirmed on Tuesday she had decided to leave the telecommunications company next year after it became clear she would not become its next chief executive.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Verizon media chief departing after not getting top job

content: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Yahoo is like a zombie feasting on Verizon’s brains. Marni Walden  a top executive at the $200 billion U.S. telecom group  is leaving just a day after the internet firm she helped to acquire tripled its tally of customer accounts exposed to a 2013 hack. While the company suggests the timing is a coincidence  it’s clear that Yahoo is a problem that continues to fester.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Breakingviews - Yahoo’s corpse keeps festering at Verizon

content: Yahoo on Tuesday said that all 3 billion of its accounts were hacked in a 2013 data theft  tripling its earlier estimate of the size of the largest breach in history  in a disclosure that attorneys said sharply increased the legal exposure of its new owner  Verizon Communications Inc . | Video
name: Altaba Inc
title: Yahoo says all three billion accounts hacked in 2013 data theft

content: WASHINGTON The chairman of the U.S. Senate Commerce Committee said on Tuesday he plans to hold a hearing later this month over massive data breaches at Equifax Inc  and Yahoo  which is now owned by Verizon Communications Inc .
name: Altaba Inc
title: Senate panel to hold hearing on Yahoo  Equifax breaches

title: Yahoo says all 3 bln accounts affected in 2013 hack

content: * Yahoo provides notice to additional users affected by previously disclosed 2013 data theft

title: BRIEF-Yahoo provides notice to additional users affected by 2013 data theft

content: Two former editorial directors at Yahoo Inc fought back against its bid to toss their lawsuit accusing the company of terminating qualified male editors in favor of a new guard of women leaders.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Former Yahoo editors say company's review system masked gender bias

content: A U.S. judge said Yahoo must face nationwide litigation brought on behalf of well over 1 billion users who said their personal information was compromised in three massive data breaches.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Yahoo must face litigation by data breach victims: U.S. judge

content: Aug 31 A U.S. judge said Yahoo must face nationwide litigation brought on behalf of well over 1 billion users who said their personal information was compromised in three massive data breaches.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Yahoo must face litigation by data breach victims -U.S. judge

content: TORONTO In his first U.S. court appearance on Wednesday  Canadian Karim Baratov pleaded not guilty to charges that he helped Russian agents in a high-profile cyber attack on Yahoo email accounts  his lawyer said.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Canadian accused in Yahoo hack pleads not guilty in U.S. court

content: Yahoo Inc owes a prize promoter $5.5 million for backing out of a contract to pay $1 billion for predicting every winner in the 2014 NCAA men's basketball tournament  and entering a similar contract with Quicken Loans Inc and Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc   a court decided on Monday.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Yahoo owes millions for busting NCAA tournament bracket deal: court

content: Aug 21 Yahoo Inc owes a prize promoter $5.5 million for backing out of a contract to pay $1 billion for predicting every winner in the 2014 NCAA men's basketball tournament  and entering a similar contract with Quicken Loans Inc and Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  a court decided on Monday.
name: Altaba Inc
title: Yahoo owes millions for busting NCAA tournament bracket deal-court
